perturbation.changed_text: In the event that the Company's Total Adjusted Capital for each of the        Company's first and third fiscal quarters (as determined based on the        Company's first and third fiscal quarterly filed statutory financial        statements, respectively, subject to any adjustments or modifications        thereto required by the Domiciliary State's insurance department or the        Company's independent auditors) falls below the Specified Minimum        Percentage of the Company's projected Company Action Level RBC (in each        case as estimated by the Company as of the end of each such first and        third fiscal quarters, as the case may be), AIG may, at its discretion, within the        respective time periods set forth under paragraph 4, in accordance with        paragraph 5 and in compliance with applicable law, provide to the        Company cash, cash equivalents, securities or other instruments that        qualify (as admitted assets) for purposes of calculating the Company's        Total Adjusted Capital, as a contribution and not as a loan, in an        amount such that the Company's Total Adjusted Capital as of the end of        each of the
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'AIG shall' to 'AIG may, at its discretion' creates ambiguity. The original text mandates AIG to provide capital if certain conditions are met. The modified version makes it optional, leading to uncertainty about AIG's obligations and potential disputes over whether AIG must provide support.

perturbation.original_text: The term "Specified Minimum Percentage" shall be equal to the        percentage set forth on Schedule 1 attached hereto, which shall be        agreed to by AIG and the Company at least once every year beginning upon        the date of the filing of the Company's 2010 Annual Statement with the        Domiciliary State's insurance department and following review against        the capital adequacy standards and criteria ("Agency Criteria") of each        of Standard & Poor's Corp. ("S&P"), Moody's Investors Service        ("Moody's") and A.M. Best Company ("A.M. Best").
perturbation.changed_text: The term "Specified Minimum Percentage" may be equal to the        percentage set forth on Schedule 1 attached hereto, which shall be        reviewed by AIG and the Company at least once every five years beginning upon        the date of the filing of the Company's 2010 Annual Statement with the        Domiciliary State's insurance department and without following review against        the capital adequacy standards and criteria ("Agency Criteria") of each        of Standard & Poor's Corp. ("S&P"), Moody's Investors Service        ("Moody's") and A.M. Best Company ("A.M. Best").
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall be equal' to 'may be equal,' changing the review from 'every year' to 'every five years' and stating that they don't need to review against capital adequacy standards creates a contradiction with the initial intention of the agreement to maintain and enhance the company's financial condition. This introduces doubt about the stability and relevance of the 'Specified Minimum Percentage'.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be amended at any time by written agreement or instrument signed by the        parties hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be amended at any time by oral agreement between authorized officers of the parties hereto. Any amendment made orally will be documented and confirmed in writing within 180 days.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original requirement for written amendments. Introducing the possibility of oral agreements followed by delayed written confirmation creates uncertainty and enforcement issues. It opens the door for disputes regarding the terms of oral amendments and whether they were properly documented.
